intro: Tonsella elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tonnelle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Tonsella elliptica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
